item.title: About AI Timeline
item.description:
About AI Timeline

Welcome to the AI Timeline, a comprehensive chronological journey through the most significant developments in artificial intelligence. Our mission is to document and showcase the evolution of AI technology, from early research breakthroughs to modern applications that are shaping our world.

Our Mission

We believe that understanding the history of AI is crucial for appreciating its current capabilities and anticipating its future impact. This timeline serves as a resource for:

item.title: GPT-4 Released by OpenAI
item.description:
Event Details

On March 14, 2023, OpenAI released GPT-4, the successor to GPT-3.5 and the foundation for ChatGPT. GPT-4 represented a significant leap forward in AI capabilities, introducing multimodal processing and improved reasoning abilities.

The model was initially available through ChatGPT Plus and the OpenAI API, with multimodal capabilities (image and text processing) released later in the year.

Key Improvements

GPT-4 brought several major advancements:

  • Multimodal Capabilities: Could process and understand images alongside text
  • Enhanced Reasoning: Significantly improved performance on complex reasoning tasks
  • Better Safety: More robust safety measures and reduced harmful outputs
  • Academic Performance: Achieved high scores on various academic and professional exams
  • Creative Capabilities: Enhanced ability for creative writing, coding, and analysis

Technical Specifications

  • Architecture: Transformer-based language model
  • Training Data: Trained on a diverse dataset including text and images
  • Parameters: Exact size not disclosed, but significantly larger than GPT-3.5
  • Context Window: 8,192 tokens (later expanded to 32,768 tokens)
  • Multimodal: Can process images, diagrams, and text simultaneously

Impact on Industry

The release of GPT-4 accelerated AI adoption across industries:

item.title: ChatGPT Released by OpenAI
item.description:
Event Details

On November 30, 2022, OpenAI released ChatGPT, a conversational AI assistant based on the GPT-3.5 architecture. The model was made available to the public as a free research preview, marking a significant milestone in the development of conversational AI.

ChatGPT demonstrated unprecedented capabilities in natural language understanding, reasoning, and generation. Users could engage in conversations on a wide range of topics, from casual chat to complex problem-solving tasks.
